Portfolio

A selection of web apps I've built or contributed to significantly.

  • Oxbridge Notes
  • Second Conscience

Oxbridge Notes

Visit Oxbridge Notes

On online marketplace where students can upload their college notes and sell them, earning a commission on every sale. I built and designed this app from scratch and have maintained it for nearly two years.

E-Commerce and Design

I cut down on development time by taking an open source e-commerce store for T-Shirts and modifying it to sell digital downloads. Above, you can see categories of notes in the left sidebar and key products displayed on the homepage. Buyers add packages of notes to the cart just like in standard e-commerce websites, and upon payment the notes are automatically delivered to them. No staff are needed to make or process sales.

ABTesting and Conversion Optimisation

In order to maximize sales I integrated an internal AB testing system. The example above shows the results of an ongoing test whereby 50% of visitors see one version of the checkout page (with a plain checkout button), and the other 50% see an alternate version with a pretty green button. The administrator learns not only the result of the test but also whether he can rely on this result as something statistically valid.

Custom Activity Feed

Administrators of the website can see all key user activities, giving them awareness of how the business is doing and what their users are up to. Prior to this the administrators would have to visit many different pages to find the same information.

Seller Area with File Management

Sellers of notes can manage their inventory and changes they make will modify the live notes for sale on the website’s front end. Shown above is one of screens in the seller’s administrative area where they can delete individual files included in certain products.

Financial Reporting

The administrator website has an overview of all the orders made over periods of time, broken down by category and by user. Using this data he learns what products sell best and so he knows where he ought to be most focusing his marketing efforts.

Second Conscience

Visit Second Consience

At the end of every day Benjamin Franklin graded his own adherence to thirteen virtues and attempted to minimize transgressions. This personal project was my attempt to bring his behavioural modification tool into the electronic age. Users add numerous “habits” and attempt to win awards by completing them continuously for extended periods. The website is called second conscience because reinforces your own conscience by harassing you with guilt emails if you forget to log in or transgress too frequently. The project is not being maintained so it may have degraded somewhat.

Bolivian Express

Visit Bolivian Express

I was the sole developer and designer for Bolivian Express, Bolivia’s major English language newspaper. Features include a CMS for articles built using Refinery, and a bespoke system for managing interns hires and payments via Paypal. I did a Rails 2.0 to Rails 3.0 upgrade on the project.

Hired Help

Visit Hired Help

Whilst the project was started by another programmer I took over as lead developer in a team of three and, amongst other things, squashed latent bugs, added automated tests and backup systems, did heavy refactoring, and built a private search engine gem for the faceted searches you see below.

About Me

Freelance Ruby on Rails programmer in central London.

Founder of Oxbridge Notes and co-founder of Bolivian Express.
